mlflex
Class LockedCallable<V>

java.lang.Object
  mlflex.LockedCallable<V>
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.util.concurrent.Callable<java.lang.Object>
public class LockedCallable<V>
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.util.concurrent.Callable<java.lang.Object>

This class encapsulates objects necessary to run tasks in parallel across multiple compute nodes. It contains logic for saving/deleting lock files and for handling errors that may occur. It also contains logic to check whether a status file has been created, which would indicate that this task has already been completed.

Constructor Detail

LockedCallable

public LockedCallable(java.lang.String simpleDescription,
                      java.util.concurrent.Callable<java.lang.Object> callable)
Constructor that accepts the objects that are necessary to support the function of this class. Thisi particular constructor is intended to be used when the task being executed is a simple one that doesn't need a complex status file or lock file. The same value is used for the status file, lock file, and lock description.

Parameters:
simpleDescription - Simple description of the task that will be executed
callable - Object that will be executed when locking is successful

LockedCallable

public LockedCallable(java.lang.String statusRelativeFilePath,
                      java.lang.String lockRelativeFilePath,
                      java.lang.String logDescription,
                      java.util.concurrent.Callable<java.lang.Object> callable)
Constructor that accepts the objects that are necessary to support the function of this class.

Parameters:
statusRelativeFilePath - Relative path to the status file that indicates whether this task has been completed previously
lockRelativeFilePath - Relative path to the lock file that will be attempted to be created
logDescription - Description fo the task being executed that will be output to the log files
callable - Object that will be executed when locking is successful
Method Detail

call

public java.lang.Object call()
                      throws java.lang.Exception
This method attempts to create a lock file that will indicate to other threads or compute nodes that the _callable task is being executed. If the file cannot be created (most likely because the task is already being executed by another thread/node, then nothing will happen.

Specified by:
call in interface java.util.concurrent.Callable<java.lang.Object>
Returns:
Result of callable
Throws:
java.lang.Exception
